posts.author: campgod
posts.content:
Hello everyone, here once again to ask for guidance. I am looking to build a PM on my server with the sole purpose for the summon. Here are some of the changes.
 Epic Dragon Knight:
Spell change: Dragon depends on alignment and class in the case of palemaster.
-->Spell Focus Conjuration: +2 Constitution, Dexterity, Stength. Duration x2.
-->Greater Spell Focus Conjuraton: +4 Constitution, Dexterity, Stength. Duration x3.
-->Epic Spell Focus Conjuration: +6 Constitution, Dexterity, Stength. Duration x4.
Dragon is hasted.
Dragon is immune to Word of Faith.
Spellcraft: The modified spellcraft check will be added to the dragon's total HP, added to it as temporary hitpoints.

Epic Dragons: A level 40 dragon will join the caster. Cleric = Lvl 40, atleast 30 wisdom. Druid = lvl 40, atleast 30 wisdom. Palemaster = lvl 30, atleast 30 in either charisma, intelligence or wisdom. Sorcerer = lvl 40, atleast 30 in charisma. Wizard = lvl 40, atleast 30 in intelligence.

So with that being said, what should I go with for the other 10 lvls? just 10 straight lvls of a caster to buff up the dragon or should I mix the other 10 with another combo? Also if you could help me with the starting stats for whichever combo as well. Thanks for your time everyone.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: With 30 PM levels, you aren't going to be much of a caster, because all spell damage and durations are based on the original caster class, not PM levels. The only thing you gain by going with 30 PM levels is spell slots, nothing more. For example, your GMW will only add a +2 bonus to the weapon and last 6 hours a day, your IGMS will only release missiles based on the number of wizard levels you have, so on and so forth. The build you want might be impossible to achieve.
